intro: Senecio promatensis, commonly known as the Mataroa Senecio, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
